Package lt.galdebar.monmonmvc.api

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • lt.galdebar.monmonmvc.api.UserController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/user")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    User Controller Used for user registration and login. Also for handling user email and password change as well as linking two user accounts together.

    • Method Detail

      • currentUser

        @GetMapping("/me")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity currentUser​(@AuthenticationPrincipal
                                                           org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
        Get current user details.
        GET request
        Requires valid Authorization Token in request header
        Header format:
        {"Authorization":"Bearer [token]"}
        Parameters:
        userDetails - UserDetails after Authorization token has been validated. Taken from the header.
        Returns:
        current user name and roles.
        Returns HTTP 403 if Authorization token invalid.

      • login

        @CrossOrigin
@PostMapping("/login")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity login​(@RequestBody
                                              LoginAttemptDTO loginAttemptDTO)
        Login.
        POST request
        Parameters:
        loginAttemptDTO - containing User Email and User Password
        Login attempt request JSON example:
        {
        "userEmail": "some@email.com",
        "userPassword": "This15APassw0rd",
        }
        Returns:
        User Email and a valid Authorization Token.
        Returns HTTP 400 if
        • Email format is empty or invalid format
        • User email not found.
        • Invalid password

      • signUp

        @CrossOrigin
@PostMapping("/register")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity signUp​(@RequestBody
                                               LoginAttemptDTO loginAttempt)
        Register new User.
        GET request
        Only begins the registration process.
        Creates the user entry in the Database and sends a registration confirmation email to the supplied address.
        Parameters:
        loginAttempt - containing User Email and User Password
        Login attempt request JSON example:
        {
        "userEmail": "some@email.com",
        "userPassword": "This15APassw0rd",
        }
        Returns:
        HTTP OK response if successful.
        Returns HTTP 400 if
        • Email format is empty or invalid format
        • User email already taken
        • Empty password

      • validateUser

        @CrossOrigin
@GetMapping("register/confirm/{token}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity validateUser​(@PathVariable
                                                     java.lang.String token)
        Confirm user registration.
        GET request
        Finalizes the registration process. User is allowed to login after this step.
        Parameters:
        token - the registration confirmation token.
        Returns:
        HTTP OK response if successful.
        Returns HTTP 400 if
        • Token is empty
        • Token invalid
        • Token expired

      • requestNewToken

        @CrossOrigin
@GetMapping(path="/register/renew/{token}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity requestNewToken​(@PathVariable
                                                        java.lang.String token)
        Renew user registration token.
        GET request
        Parameters:
        token - the token
        Returns:
        HTTP OK response if successful.
        Returns HTTP 400 if
        • Token is empty
        • Token invalid
        • Token not expired yet

      • changeEmail

        @CrossOrigin
@PostMapping("/changeemail")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity changeEmail​(@RequestBody
                                                    EmailChangeRequestDTO emailChangeRequestDTO)
        Change current user Email.
        POST request
        User can still login with the old email, until email change is confirmed.
        Requires valid Authorization Token in request header
        Header format:
        {"Authorization":"Bearer [token]"}
        Parameters:
        emailChangeRequestDTO - contains new Email Address.
        Email change request JSON example:
        {
        "newEmail": "some@email.com",
        }
        Returns:
        HTTP OK response if successful. Also sends confirmation email to the supplied new address.
        Returns HTTP 400 if
        • Email empty or invalid format
        • Email already taken
        • Token not expired yet

        Returns HTTP 403 if Authorization token is
        • Empty
        • Invalid
        • Expired

      • confirmEmailChange

        @CrossOrigin
@GetMapping("/changeemail/confirm/{token}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity confirmEmailChange​(@PathVariable
                                                           java.lang.String token)
        Confirm user email change.
        GET request
        Parameters:
        token - the token
        Returns:
        HTTP OK response if successful.
        Returns HTTP 400 if
        • Token is empty
        • Token invalid
        • Token not expired yet

      • changePassword

        @CrossOrigin
@PostMapping("/changepassword")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity changePassword​(@RequestBody
                                                       PasswordChangeRequestDTO passwordChangeRequestDTO)
        Change current user Password.
        POST request
        Requires valid Authorization Token in request header
        Header format:
        {"Authorization":"Bearer [token]"}
        Parameters:
        passwordChangeRequestDTO - contains current user Email Address (for verification), old password and new password.
        Password change request JSON example:
        {
        "userEmail": "some@email.com",
        "oldPassword": "This15APassw0rd",
        "newPassword": "5omeNewPassword",
        }
        Returns:
        HTTP OK response if successful. Also sends confirmation email to the supplied address.
        Returns HTTP 400 if
        • Email empty or invalid format
        • Email doesn't match current user
        • Password empty
        • Old and new passwords match
        • Old password is incorrect

        Returns HTTP 403 if Authorization token is
        • Empty
        • Invalid
        • Expired

      • markUserForDeletion

        @CrossOrigin
@GetMapping("/deleteuser")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity markUserForDeletion()
        Request delete current user.
        GET request
        Only begins the registration process. Process finishes after time set in UserService. If the user logs in within the grace period, deletion is cancelled.
        Requires valid Authorization Token in request header
        Header format:
        {Authorization:Bearer [token]}
        Returns:
        HTTP OK response if successful. Also sends warning email to the current user email.
        Returns HTTP 403 if Authorization token is
        • Empty
        • Invalid
        • Expired

      • getLinkedUsers

        @CrossOrigin
@GetMapping("/getlinkedusers")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getLinkedUsers()
        Gets linked users.
        GET request
        Requires valid Authorization Token in request header
        Header format:
        {Authorization:Bearer [token]}
        Returns:
        List (String) of users linked with the current user.

      • linkUsers

        @CrossOrigin
@PostMapping("/link")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity linkUsers​(@RequestBody
                                                  UserDTO userDTO)
        Link users request.
        POST request
        Requires valid Authorization Token in request header
        Header format:
        {"Authorization":"Bearer [token]"}
        Parameters:
        userDTO - containing email of the other user (other fields can be empty).
        Full User JSON example:
        {
        "userEmail": "some@email.com",
        "userPassword": "This15APassw0rd",
        "linkedUsers": "["someother@mail.com", "another@mail.this"]",
        }
        Returns:
        HTTP OK response if successful. Also sends confirmation link to the user in userDTO.
        Returns HTTP 400 if other user email
        • Is empty or invalid format
        • isn't found in users DB
        • matches the current user
        Returns HTTP 403 if Authorization token is
        • Empty
        • Invalid
        • Expired

      • confirmLinkUsers

        @CrossOrigin
@GetMapping("link/confirm/{token}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity confirmLinkUsers​(@PathVariable
                                                         java.lang.String token)
        Confirm link users response entity.
        GET request
        Parameters:
        token - the token
        Returns:
        HTTO Ok response if successful
        Returns HTTP 400 if token is
        • Empty
        • Invalid
        • Expired

      • renewLinkUsersToken

        @CrossOrigin
@GetMapping("link/renew/{token}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity renewLinkUsersToken​(@PathVariable
                                                            java.lang.String token)
        Renew link users token.
        GET request
        Parameters:
        token - the token
        Returns:
        HTTP Ok response
        Returns HTTP 400 if
        • Token is empty
        • Token invalid
        • Token not expired yet
